text: Åke Fredrik Hellman (19 July 1915 – 18 December 2017) was a Finnish still life and portrait artist and art professor. He has worked as art teacher at the University of Helsinki. In 1963, he received the order of the Lion of Finland. He was born in Helsinki. Hellman turned 100 on 19 July 2015. He died on 18 December 2017 in Borgå, Finland, at the age of 102. ==References== ==Other websites== * Hellman, Åke in Uppslagsverket Finland. * Åke Hellman and his artistship. * A Shared Atelier – Karin and Åke Hellman at Kunsthalle Helsinki. title: Åke Hellman
